body: Does it crash on OS X? If so you should be able to get the crash report from the `Console.app`.

@zcbenz  thanks for replying, We tried to read the codes, if we right crash dump would be generated in windows @location user/AppData/Local/Temp/upload_xxxxx 

meta info about crash generated on same directory folder-name 

```
"<app name><space><'Crashes'>"
ex : crash_demo Crashes
``
We will try to get the crash dmp asap.
```

@zcbenz  we have pre-beta testers, they are having windows only. so mac occurrence is comparatively less to reproduce, and have got some crash dumps. please let us know if more samples needed.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/42787852/electron-app/electron_0.30.2_crash_dmp.zip

Hi 
some more samples, " highlighted text and clicked " Render/Browser Window crashed and turned white.
dmp : https://db.tt/W6ytfu39

Hello, is these samples give any info of crash occurrence. just to confirm, are they relevant to the issue reported. all webview based electron apps should face this crash issue. our users are facing this issues one session or other day.

Please let us know if any info needed from our end to fix this one.
It should have been fixed in v0.31.0, can you have a try?
Sure thanks.
I'm assuming it has been fixed.
Couple days before we have released our app within beta tester group. Will update thread if we come across this issue again. Thanks

Hi. 
We got reports for our test users, on same issue. I could get the crash reports and put it in an CDN providing the link. Can we please re-open this issue.

Engine versions details :
Electron : 0.32.2
OS : Win 8.1 64bit
@zcbenz  Thanks for re-opening the issue, I will get the crash reports by EOD.

some more samples , https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/42787852/electron-app/sample3.zip am not sure where is the dmp file here. i have id alone

Electron engine 0.32.2

Hi @zcbenz 
another crash dmp sample, we have embedded crash collection in our production app, please check and let us know. http://goo.gl/UkdduA

http://goo.gl/CxikoM reports are collected from engine 0.33.6
os : windows 7 and 8

In 0.33.7, we are can see this fix, we would try the latest engine and update users to see 
whether it cuts down white screen / reduces the occurrences.

```
- Fix uncaught exception when releasing a remote object in browser process.

```

0.33.7 - dmp file , 
http://goo.gl/31SU3e ( when webview started to embed application went white screen )
http://goo.gl/QSQjA1

@kamesh-a When did the crash happen? I've seen white screens in an Electron-wrapped app when waking up a MacBook from deep sleep (Hibernate). 

From the logs I could see this message:

> [10194:1014/074924:WARNING:dns_config_service_posix.cc(298)] Failed to read DnsConfig.
> online-status-changed false
@bennyn  all crash dumps are collected from Windows users. We have don't have any production users on mac.

```
When did the crash happen?
```

@bennyn Our app is typical type of custom browser, we load different website inside the app, so we are using webview injection, couple crashes have occurred when we injected webview into DOM, some other crashes were reported when using context menu (  mouse right click  on webview guest page ).

But render white screen happens at some other scenarios as well, so we are not pretty sure what is causing. Currently we are unable to debug c++ dmp files.

It usually happens after a deep sleep of the machine (we are working on the same project with @bennyn). It's not consistent and that's what makes it really annoying. It doesn't happen if you just force the machine to sleep or disconnect the network connection. Usually after a few hours of sleep, it doesn't wake up nicely.

It seems that your drag-drop related code has triggered a bug in blink and resulted in crash, however why this happened & how to fix it is totally unknown to me, a search in Chromium's issues list also has no results.

The best solution is probably to try to reproduce the crash in Chrome and report it to upstream.
Hello @zcbenz Thanks for looking into it. Just curious to know, is all the stack trace point to Drag and drop sequence?
Yeah all the dump files have the same stack trace.

Hello @zcbenz. I am struggling with white screen issue. Crash happened when I launched electron app and about 15 minutes later it did. Crash dump file was generated at a location mentioned above. @zcbenz Could you check this dump file has same stack trace with @kamesh-a's ? 

crash dump file (on windows 8.1, 64bit. electron v0.33.9)
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_dw0ZZiDvrxd19TbUR0dEdBYzg/view?usp=sharing

thank you!
@debussy2k it crashed at https://github.com/atom/electron/blob/v0.33.9/atom/browser/api/atom_api_app.cc#L187, which is a quite surprising place, you probably need to update to a newer version.

Thank you for reply @zcbenz.
I updated to electron v0.34.3 and installed crash report in render process. The crash is reproduced but dump files that I uploaded yesterday are generated from main process. It seems obvious that crash occurred in render process (in BrowserWindow) and I post it. Please check this and I wish I can get a clue for this. 
Thank you @zcbenz 

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_dw0ZZiDvrxRjhtYzhTT1Rzd2c/view?usp=sharing
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_dw0ZZiDvrxYzBHaFdtVlZlZmc/view?usp=sharing

Wow, Svg filter effect caused several problems. Weird thing was that svg filter was normaly fine but in some cases  it made crash. We are replacing svg filter with other method. 
@zcbenz you saved my day.  Thanks!

We're seeing this with our Electron app, Light Table, on two recent versions of Mac OS X. We're using version 0.34.5 of Electron currently.

Here's [a crash dump](https://gist.github.com/kenny-evitt/c7a36abd8a52d8a7859b).

At least for the crash dump to which I linked above, we seem also to be having an out-of-memory error:

@kenny-evitt When you saw out of memory crash, it is either your app is creating a very large `Buffer`, or your app is leaking memory and finally reached memory limit. In your case it is more likely caused by the latter one, and you can take a heap snapshot in devtools to find out the leak.
@zcbenz Thanks  we'll look into further on our end then. Thanks for Electron!
Thanks guy, I also encounter the issue those day in electron 0.36.9, It seen like the issue is still existing , does some someone has resolved it?
I'm closing this since the original report was quite old and there was no updates for recent versions of Electron.

Hello @zcbenz thought of updating the thread, 0.34.x exhibits the white screen, but all higher version till 0.37.x entire program gets crashed, even crash reporter is unable to pick up the data, background thread itself crashing. but code remains the same. 

Is there any way we could find why it is crashing, it is only crashing in some machines for users not in our dev machine. Please let us know if there is anything we could do to get the debugging info.
Hi ! Anyone manage to catch the render process crash exception and quit the app accordingly ?

@gabrielstuff we listen for  "crashed" event in main background process and restart the appropriate renderer Browser-window. so after this event either program can be made to  quit or respawn the renderer back
im going to add the code for the fix on this at pull request

Hello @zcbenz 

> https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/2409  we are getting "[nullptr](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/42787852/electron-app/stackNullPtr.txt)" while it is trying to access it.  [setDestinationOperation](https://cs.chromium.org/chromium/src/third_party/WebKit/Source/core/clipboard/DataTransfer.cpp?sq=package:chromium&rcl=1475493501&l=405)
> was searching for this source in chromium codes

as you said it is in blink, we tried to build electron, but chromium source code ( we could not find there ) was able to track till libchromiumcontent and unable proceed after that point.  Any help on how to proceed forward.
